verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. In Jehovah<WH3068> do I take refuge<WH2620>: How say<WH559> ye to my soul<WH5315>, Flee<WH5110> as a bird<WH6833> to your mountain<WH2022>;

For <WH7563>, lo, the wicked bend<WH1869> the bow<WH7198>, They make ready<WH3559> their arrow<WH2671> upon the string<WH3499>, That they may shoot<WH3384> in darkness<WH652> at the upright<WH3477> in heart<WH3820>;
If the foundations<WH8356> be destroyed<WH2040>, What can the righteous<WH6662> do<WH6466>?

Jehovah <WH3068> is in his holy<WH6944> temple<WH1964>; Jehovah<WH3068>, his throne<WH3678> is in heaven<WH8064>; His eyes<WH5869> behold<WH2372>, his eyelids<WH6079> try<WH974>, the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>.
Jehovah <WH3068> trieth<WH974> the righteous<WH6662>; But the wicked<WH7563> and him that loveth<WH157> violence<WH2555> his soul<WH5315> hateth<WH8130>.
Upon the wicked<WH7563> he will rain<WH4305> snares<WH6341>; Fire<WH784> and brimstone<WH1614> and burning<WH2152> wind<WH7307> shall be the portion<WH4521> of their cup<WH3563>.
For Jehovah<WH3068> is righteous<WH6662>; He loveth<WH157> righteousness<WH6666>: The upright<WH6662> shall behold<WH2372> his face<WH6440>.
